metro.WindowControls

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.WindowControls.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a simple but fancy window with some extra functions like Control-management (managing buttons, labels, etc.).
    Author:
    hauke

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(java.lang.String title,
      java.awt.Point position,
      java.awt.Point size,
      java.awt.Color color)
        Creates a new window.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the Window, is shown in the top area.
        position - The position on the Screen (absolute)
        size - The size in pixel (absolute)
        color - The color of the border

      • Window

        public Window(java.lang.String title,
      java.awt.Point position,
      java.awt.Point size)
        Creates a new window.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the Window, is shown in the top area.
        position - The position on the Screen (absolute)
        size - The size in pixel (absolute)

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch g)
        Draws the window and all controls on it.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphic handle.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates everything. Is very important for e.g. drag-feature and Controls

      • addControlElement

        public void addControlElement(ControlElement cElement)
        Adds a new control to the window control list. If the new Control is already in the list, it won't be added again, so there are no doubles in this list.
        Parameters:
        cElement - The WindowControl element thta should be added.

      • isMouseOnWindow

        public boolean isMouseOnWindow(int screenX,
                      int screenY)
        Returns true is mouse is in window, false if not and also false if in window but e.g. on a button.
        Parameters:
        screenX - x-coordinate of mouse
        screenY - y-coordinate of mouse
        Returns:
        boolean True/false if mouse is in window.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(int screenX,
                int screenY,
                int mouseButton)
        Makes things when mouse is pressed.
        Parameters:
        screenX - The x-coordinate of the click
        screenY - The y-coordinate of the click
        mouseButton - The mouse button (using gdx.Input.Buttons)

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased()
        Makes things when mouse is released (important for drag-mode of the window).

      • mouseScrolled

        public void mouseScrolled(int amount)
        Fires when users scrolls.
        Parameters:
        amount - Positive or negative amount of steps since last frame.

      • closeIfNeeded

        public boolean closeIfNeeded(int screenX,
                    int screenY,
                    int mouseButton)
        Closes the window if the mouse is on the cross. NO CLICK is needed in this function, be careful. This function calls the METRO.__close() function to close itself.
        Returns:
        True if the window has been closed, false if not.

      • getPosition

        public java.awt.Point getPosition()
        Returns the position of the window.
        Returns:
        Position.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the window softly.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns true if window has been successfully removed from the window list.
        Returns:
        True - Already removed, False - Still exists

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(int keyCode)
        Gets called when a key is pressed. Controls should
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Key code of the pressed key.

      • keyUp

        public void keyUp(int keyCode)
